summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Mr. R. Couri Hay, commanding his appearance on July 31, 2019, to testify and produce documents in an investigation into alleged violations of federal sex trafficking and conspiracy statutes. The document includes an advice of rights and a request to keep the subpoena confidential.

persons.name: R. Couri Hay
persons.context: The individual commanded to appear before the grand jury to testify and produce documents in connection with an investigation into alleged violations of federal sex trafficking and conspiracy laws.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed and issued the grand jury subpoena and the accompanying request for confidentiality.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is issuing a legal command (subpoena) to Hay to appear and testify before a grand jury.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: R. Couri Hay is commanded to appear before the Grand Jury for the Southern District of New York to testify and give evidence.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felony violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 2421 (transportation for prostitution), 2422 (coercion and enticement), 2423 (transportation of minors), and 371 (conspiracy).

The U.S. Attorney's Office requested the recipient, R. Couri Hay, to voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The subpoena commands the recipient to bring and produce unspecified items, as referenced in an attached 'Advice of Rights' document.
